name: Wasif Naeem
content: Business Card | School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science | Queen's University Belfast Top Business Card Professor Wasif NaeemPhD, MSc, BE, FHEA Professor in Autonomous Systems and Robotics E-mail: Phone: +44 (0)28 9097 4066 Fax: +44 (0)28 9097 5449 Research Profile: pure.qub.ac.uk/en/persons/wasif-naeem Room: 08.022Ashby Building,Stranmillis Road PostalAddress: School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, The Queen's University Belfast, Ashby Building, Stranmillis Road Belfast, BT9 5AH Research Interests: Control algorithms development for unmanned systems including robotics Collision avoidance strategies for unmanned aerial, marine and ground vehicles System identification and modelling of electro-mechanical systems Research Clusters:   Energy, Power and Intelligent Control School & University Responsibilities: Director of Internationalisation, EEECS (2018 - todate) MSc Electronics Programme Director (2017 - 2018) IET Accreditation Coordinator (2014-2017) Stage 2 Coordinator (2013 - 2016) EEE awards and prizes coordinator (2010 - 2013) EPIC Cluster Webmaster (2007 - to date) External Activities: Member, EPSRC Peer Review College Fellow Higher Education Academy (FHEA) Member, IFAC T7.2 Technical Committee on Marine Systems Member IET (MIET) General Chair, Irish Signals and Systems Conference, Belfast, June 2018 Local Organising Chair, UKACC International Conference on Control, Belfast, Aug/Sep 2016 UK Publications Chair and IPC Member, 2nd International Conference on Intelligent Computing for Sustainable Energy and Environment (ICSEE) Conference, Shanghai, China, September 2012 Committee member, IEEE SMC Chapter, Ireland Foreign Editor, Asian Journal of Engineering Science and Technology UK Publications Chair and IPC Member, International Conferences on Life System Modeling and Simulation, China, September 2010 UK Publications Chair and IPC Member, International Conference on Intelligent Computing for Sustainable Energy and Environment, China, September 2010 Steering and programme committee member of the IET Irish Signals and Systems Conference since 2008 Expert Reviewer, Research Council of Norway Meet Our People © Queen's University Belfast 2024 Privacy and cookies Website accessibility Freedom of information Modern slavery statement Equality, Diversity and Inclusion University Policies and Procedures Information Privacy and cookies Website accessibility Freedom of information Modern slavery statement Equality, Diversity and Inclusion University Policies and Procedures © Queen's University Belfast 2024 Manage cookies
